incidents.name: Inbound Calls From AT&T Wireless to Twilio Toll-Free Numbers are Failing

incident_updates.body: The issue affecting inbound calls from AT&T wireless to Twilio toll-free phone numbers has been resolved, and the service is functioning normally at this time.

We have started seeing recovery for inbound calls from AT&T wireless to Twilio toll-free phone numbers. We will continue to monitor to ensure a full recovery. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are continuing to observe intermittent inbound call failures from AT&T wireless to Twilio toll-free numbers. We are currently working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 16 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are still observing few Inbound call failures from ATT wireless to Twilio Toll-free numbers. We are currently working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are observing few Inbound call failures from ATT wireless to Twilio Toll-free numbers. We are currently working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Unable to Attach Files to Tickets via Twilio Console

incident_updates.body: We have fully investigated the issue with support ticket file uploads in response to customer reports, and it was determined that the ticket file attachment system is working as designed. There is no noticeable customer impact. Twilio Console is operating normally at this time. All systems are operational.

We are continuing to see degraded performance on our Twilio Console. Our engineering team is looking into the issue. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are currently seeing degraded performance on our Twilio Console. Our engineering team is looking into the issue. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are currently seeing degraded performance on our Twilio Console. Our engineering team is looking into the issue. We expect to provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Voice Insight Errors

incident_updates.body: The small percentage of voice SDK error events being published to the Voice Insights gateway has been identified. Our investigation revealed that all of the errors were limited to unsupported versions of our SDKs. The service is operating normally at this time.

We are observing a small percentage (<1.5%) of Voice SDK events being published to the Voice Insights gateway are receiving errors. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Voice SDK. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: A2P 10DLC Campaign Vetting Delays

incident_updates.body:
Since January 26, 2023, the A2P vetting registration process has required an additional manual verification step, and this additional step is completed by an external third party. Customers are still able to submit new campaign requests and resubmit previous rejected ones; however, this manual verification process is experiencing a high volume of requests, so it is expected that customers will continue to face delays while vetting 10DLC campaigns.

Twilio will continue to work with the third party agency to expedite and improve verification processes delays. However, since reviews are expected to take longer from now on due this additional verification step, this incident will be closed. If you need further information about your campaign registration, please contact support for further assistance.

We continue to face delays while vetting 10DLC campaigns. A third party agency is reviewing campaigns manually and due to the high volume of requests, a queue has built up. Customers are able to submit their Campaign requests. However, reviews are expected to take longer. Twilio continues to escalate the situation and work with the provider to help expedite this process. We will provide updates as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue to face delays while vetting 10DLC campaigns. A 3rd party agency is reviewing campaigns manually and due to the high volume of requests, a queue has built up. Campaign reviews are expected to take over 15 business days approximately until the situation is resolved. Twilio is working with the provider to help expedite this process. We will provide another update on 03/03/2023 at 10:45 am Pacific Time or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue to face delays while vetting 10DLC campaigns. A 3rd party agency is reviewing campaigns manually and due to the high volume of requests, a queue has built up. Campaign reviews are expected to take over 15 business days approximately until the situation is resolved. Twilio is working with the provider to help expedite this process. We will provide another update every 7 days. Next update will be provided on 02/24/2023 at 10:45 am Pacific Time or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue to face delays while vetting 10DLC campaigns. A 3rd party agency is reviewing campaigns manually and due to the high volume of requests, a queue has built up. Campaign reviews are expected to take over 7 days until the situation is resolved. Twilio is working with the provider to help expedite this process. We expect to provide another update in next 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue to face delays while vetting 10DLC campaigns. A 3rd party agency is reviewing campaigns manually and due to the high volume of requests, a queue has built up. Campaign reviews are expected to take over 7 days until the situation is resolved. Twilio is working with the provider to help expedite this process. We expect to provide another update in next 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue to face delays while vetting 10DLC campaigns. A 3rd party agency is reviewing campaigns manually and due to the high volume of requests, a queue has built up. Campaign reviews are expected to take over 7 days until the situation is resolved. Twilio is working with the provider to help expedite this process. We expect to provide another update in next 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Error 53113 “Room Exists” When Creating Video Rooms via API

incident_updates.body: The issue of creating video rooms via API has been resolved. Video Rooms via API is operating normally at this time.
Video Rooms via API is now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

A subset of customers might continue receiving 53113 - “Room exists” error when creating video rooms via API, if rooms with the same name were previously created. As a workaround, customers can create rooms with different names. Our engineers implemented temporary measures to make this issue less frequent until a permanent solution is created. We will provide another update in 72 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

A subset of customers might receive 53113 - “Room exists” error when creating video rooms via API, if rooms with the same name were previously created. We will provide another update in 72 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Issues With New WhatsApp Senders Creation

incident_updates.body: The issue of new customers creating new WhatsApp senders was detected to begin March 16th and has now been resolved. Any impacted customers may retry creating WhatsApp senders. WhatsApp is operating normally at this time.

We are observing recovery in new customers creating new WhatsApp senders. We will continue monitoring the service to ensure a full recovery. We will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified that the issue causing errors when creating new WhatsApp senders is only impacting new customers. Existing customers should not be impacted. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.
